H0.text: who was isaac newton and what did he do. Mathematician

H1.text: who was isaac newton and what did he do. Physicist

H2.text: who was isaac newton and what did he do. Astronomer

H3.text: who was isaac newton and what did he do. Chemist

A4.text: His book Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica (Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy), first published in 1687, achieved the first great⍨unification in physics and established classical mechanics.

A5.text: He showed how to predict the courses of heavenly bodies and so established our place in the cosmos.

A6.text: Newton combined knowledge of celestial motions with the study of events on Earth and showed that one theory of mechanics could encompass both.

A7.text: Newton used them to investigate and explain the motion of many physical objects and systems.

A8.text: Newton was uncomfortable with the idea of action at a distance, which was a key aspect of his theory of gravity.

A9.text: Newton's law of universal gravitation was later superseded by Einstein's theory of general relativity, but it remains an excellent approximation in most applications.
